story.text: Jan 2 Freddie Mac FRE.N on Tuesday said that it sold $3.0 billion in its weekly reference bill auction. Freddie Mac sold $1.5 billion of three-month reference bills due April 2, 2007 at a stop-out rate of 5.133 percent and $1.5 billion of six-month reference bills due July 2, 2007 at a stop-out rate of 5.071 percent. The three-month bills were priced at 98.7310 and have a money market yield of 5.199 percent and the six-month bills priced at 97.4645 and have a money market yield of 5.203 percent. Settlement is Jan. 3.
story.title: freddie mac sells $ 3 billion in bills
